Info: Tangible evidence of-surface deposits, for example, where a section has been exposed that reveals cultural material, or where cultural materials are seen to be eroding from a portion of the feature (e.g. on a slope)
No unambiguous evidence of sub-surface deposits, but the characterstics of the landform (e.g. aggrading land surface) and local archaeology are highly suggestive of such deposits existing
Sub-surface deposits are considered unlikely, due to the characterstics of the landform (e.g. badly eroded surface), but the potential for such deposits to occur can not be ruled out.
Situations where sub-surface deposits can be ruled out due to the landform characteristics (e.g. a substrate of bedrock, clay hardpan or, stones and rubble)
